newsitem.title: USA: Rhone-Poulenc Rorer names new president.
newsitem.headline: Rhone-Poulenc Rorer names new president.

text.p: Rhone-Poulenc Rorer said Thursday its board named Timothy Rothwell president, effective immediately. Rothwell takes the title from Michel de Rosen, who remains chairman and chief executive.
The board also named Manfred Karobath and Patrick Langlois as executive vice presidents, the company said.

The company said Rothwell was executive vice president and president of its pharmaceutical operations, and that Karobath and Langlois, who was chief financial officer, were both senior vice presidents. The company said all will keep their current responsibilities.
